result.execSummary:
The defendant Chuntazia S Cox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chuntazia S Cox in court.  Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Chuntazia S Cox.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for sentencing.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.  Additional statements by: S.D. and D.L. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to Count 2, with credit for 0 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges for work and child care.  Court allows for good time credit.  REPORT DATE: November 1, 2022 by 5:00 PM.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3.5 YEARS with 0 days credit, CONSECUTIVE to Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS ELIGIBLE for the WI Substance Abuse program.

AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- AS TO COUNT 2: 6 MONTHS condition time IMPOSED AND STAYED and to be used at the Department's discretion.  Court granted Huber release for work and child care.  Court allows good time credit.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- Provide DNA sample.
- No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
- Maintain employment or be enrolled in school.
- Complete 50 hours of community service.  
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
- Complete anger management course.
- Apology letter to victim S.D.
- Complete a psychological or psychiatric evaluation and follow through with any recommended services or treatment. 
- NO CONTACT with Convergence Resource Center and victims S.D. and D.L. 

- Restitution set at $1,350.00 payable to victim S.D. and $19,866.60 payable to American Family Mutual Insurance Company. 


Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  Court further ordered that payment to victim S.D. shall be paid FIRST, before court costs, fees, and surcharges. 

Firearms and voting warnings given.  20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Chuntazia S Cox in court.  Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Chuntazia S Cox.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties. Additional statement made by D. Lassiter.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, she may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Sentencing adjourned in Branch 02.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Jury instructions for plea hearing.
Amended Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea.

OFF THE RECORD via Zoom. Defense requests a plea date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Revised No Contact Order

Court order the case adjourned to Branch 2.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Chuntazia S Cox in court with attorney Conner Helvig.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Debbie L.; and Sarah D.

Defendant Chuntazia S Cox in court with attorney Conner Helvig.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 1.
